DataElement.preferredName: Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Pulp Horn Hemorrhage Event Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to hemorrhage (flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel) in the portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp in treatment by removal of tooth decay that has invaded dentin of tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Pulp Horn Hemorrhage Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to hemorrhage (flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel) in the portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp in treatment by removal of tooth decay that has invaded dentin of tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.:Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.
Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.:Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
Something that happens at a given place and time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update
